intro: Baeobotrys fulvinervis, commonly known as the golden nettle, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Urticaceae, which includes many stinging plants. The plant is characterized by its opposite, ovate leaves with a distinctive golden-yellow venation. Its small, greenish-white flowers are clustered in umbels, and it produces small, dry fruits called schizocarps. Baeobotrys fulvinervis is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forest understories.
